ref: 12481 śiṣṭi2 f. ʻ direction ʼ Pat., ʻ punishment ʼ Gaut. [√śās]
S. siṭhiṇo m. ʻ marriage song at wedding ʼ, siṭhaṇu ʻ to compose abusive verses ʼ;
L. siṭṭh f. ʻ satirical poem ʼ;
P. siṭṭh f. ʻ an obscene composition ʼ, siṭṭhṇā ʻ to compose such ʼ, siṭṭhṇī f. ʻ obscene song sung by women at weddings ʼ;
bhal. śiṭhṛi f. ʻ vulgar jokes made by bride's female friends and relatives at the bridegroom's party ʼ; śiṭṭhṇū ʻ to make faces at ʼ;
bhal. śiṭhṛi f. ʻ vulgar jokes made by bride's female friends and relatives at the bridegroom's party ʼ; śiṭṭhṇū ʻ to make faces at ʼ;
H. siṭhnī f., ˚nā m. ʻ abuse uttered at weddings ʼ. Prob. euphem. for *aśiṣṭi -- ʻ rude behaviour ʼ, aśiṣṭa -- ʻ rude ʼ Āp.
